categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several pull requests have been submitted to the elizaOS/eliza repository addressing various fixes and improvements:

- PR #4327 by wtfsayo normalizes plugin commands across v1 and v2 versions
- PR #4325 by UD1sto fixes GPU recognition issues in Docker containers
- PR #4326 by detrina corrects an error in the MemoryCacheAdapter.md documentation
- PR #4332 by 0xbbjoker improves schema type safety
- PR #4330 by UD1sto introduces Docker improvements
- PR #4328 by tcm390 fixes a GUI issue by synchronizing environment states with updated characterValue properties

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several improvements and bug fixes were recently merged into the elizaOS/eliza repository:

1. Added Default Agents based on organization (PR #4323) - This enhancement introduces default agents that are configured according to the organization settings.

2. Multiple bug fixes were implemented:
   - Plugin command normalization across v1 and v2 (PR #4327)
   - Prevention of repetitive agent replies (PR #4331)
   - Fixed OpenAI speech-to-text functionality (PR #4329)
   - GUI fix to synchronize environment states with updated characterValue properties (PR #4328)

Over the past two days (April 20-22, 2025), the elizaos/eliza repository has shown consistent development activity. The project had a total of 9 new pull requests, with 5 of them successfully merged. No new issues were reported during this period. The repository maintained a steady contributor base with 6 active contributors working on the project throughout this timeframe. Activity increased on the second day with 6 new PRs compared to 3 on the first day.

The provided sources mention 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' but do not provide any specific details about who these contributors are or their contributions to the project. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary about the individual contributors, their roles, or the nature of their contributions to the elizaOS/eliza project.
